ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much more about Indonesias political, societal, and environmental spheres. INDN 150 really emphasizes writing and listening, both of which I definitely improved in!
Intermediate/advanced Indonesian language skills plus a deep understanding of political and social issues affecting modern Indonesia.

I learned the history of Jakarta, the new city, heroes in Indonesia, the culture around the criminal justice system and homelessness. I learned how to better understand the Indonesian language and how to better speak it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Bu Dinny is very flexible as a professor and all of our assignments were well designed. 
Weaknesses: I think youll learn more Indonesian if you actually try during class and for assignments. I personally felt like most of the students werent trying whatsoever.
This course is well-taught, easy, and extremely engaging - I highly recommend it and the Indonesian language program at Yale in general.

The main weakness of this course was it only met one day a week. Although this is the structure of L5, I greatly enjoyed the class and wanted to have it more! 
The design of the class was the greatest strength. I always knew what to expect and felt that I was set up for success.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommend if you want to explore Indonesian culture, politics, and society according to your interests!

Yes! Bu is so nice and caring, and the weekly 1 on 1 chat w/ her is an incredible way to build up your language skills. The topics covered vary depending on your interests/the interests of other students in the class, which I found very refreshing.

Definitely- I think this course took the language of learning to the next step. I was able to engage more with specific topics of Indonesia and learned a ton about what it would be like if I actually went to Indonesia.
